Books

These are some helpful and higly recommended books for web development.

Filter by Technology

Click on a technology

HTML & CSS

Jon Duckett

Amazon

Jon Duckett's book was my first. It is a beautifully designed book filled with examples. He goes over HTML and CSS in great depth, carefully explaining each principle in full before moving on.

JavaScript & jQuery

Jon Duckett

Amazon

Jon Duckett's next book is as informative as the first. JavaScript & jQuery is an indepth book on the language and its most popular library. He'll take you through the basics of programming to techniques like AJAX.

JavaScript: The Good Parts

Douglas Crockford

Amazon

JavaScript has had a very bumpy development, making it in some ways a very strange language. Douglas Crockford explains in this book, the good parts of JavaScript and how to write elegant and beautiful code.

You Don't Know JS: Up and Going

Kyle Simpson

Amazon

Kyle Simpson gives us a more complete view of JavaScript. This book gives you the basic background in JavaScript programming that you'll need to go further into his series.

You Don't Know JS: this & Object Prototypes

Kyle Simpson

Amazon

this and Object Prototypes walks you through the this keyword and the complexities of JavaScript objects. Like the other books in the series, this book encourages us to understand, rather than avoid, the more complicated parts of the language.

You Don't Know JS: Scope & Closures

Kyle Simpson

Amazon

Scope and Closures covers the difficult concept of closures, how they work, how scope works with closures, and how to best take advantage of them.

You Don't Know JS: Types & Grammar

Kyle Simpson

Visit

Types and Grammer goes in depth about the various types in JavaScript. It discusses coercion and how these types can be confounding or useful.

You Don't Know JS: Async & Performance

Kyle Simpson

Visit

Continuing the YDKJS series, Kyle Simpson covers the async and await abilities of JavaScript and goes over optimizing the language's performance.

You Don't Know JS: ES6 & Beyond

Kyle Simpson

Visit

This is a fantastic book for a resource.

Eloquent JavaScript

Marijn Haverbeke

Visit

This is a fantastic book for a resource.

React Quickly

Azat Mardan

Visit

This is a fantastic book for a resource.

The Road to React

Robin Weiruch

Visit

This is a fantastic book for a resource.

Beginning Angular with Typescript

Greg Lim

Visit

Angular is a popular framework and this book teaches everything you need to know to master it. The book is straightforward and has you building apps within minutes. While it may have TypeScript in the title, the book does not assume experience with TypeScript.
